org.icepdf.core.pobjects.annotations

Class AbstractWidgetAnnotation<T extends FieldDictionary>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.icepdf.core.pobjects.Dictionary
      • org.icepdf.core.pobjects.annotations.Annotation
        • org.icepdf.core.pobjects.annotations.AbstractWidgetAnnotation<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ButtonWidgetAnnotation, ChoiceWidgetAnnotation, SignatureWidgetAnnotation, TextWidgetAnnotation, WidgetAnnotation

    public abstract class AbstractWidgetAnnotation<T extends FieldDictionary>
extends Annotation
    Abstract base class for Widget annotations types, button, choice and text.
    Since:
    5.1

      • findBoundRectangle

        protected Rectangle2D.Float findBoundRectangle(String markedContent)
        Generally immediately after the BMC there is a rectangle that defines the actual size of the annotation. If found we can use this to make many assumptions and regenerate the content stream.
        Parameters:
        markedContent - content stream of the marked content.
        Returns:
        a rectangle either way, if the q # # # # re isn't found then we use the bbox as a potential bound.

      • findRectangle

        protected Rectangle2D.Float findRectangle(String markedContent)
        Finds a rectangle in the marked content.
        Parameters:
        markedContent - content to search for a rectangle.
        Returns:
        rectangle if found, otherwise bbox is used.

      • getLineHeight

        protected double getLineHeight(String defaultAppearance)
        Get the line height as specified by Th or the font size.
        Parameters:
        defaultAppearance - searchable stream
        Returns:
        line height, or 13.87 if no reasonable approximation can be found.

      • getFontSize

        protected double getFontSize(String content)

      • encodeLiteralString

        protected StringBuilder encodeLiteralString(StringBuilder content,
                                            String contents)
        Encodes the given cotents string into a valid postscript string that is literal encoded.
        Parameters:
        content - current content stream to append literal string to.
        contents - string to be encoded into '(...)' literal format.
        Returns:
        original content stream with contents encoded in the literal string format.

      • encodeHexString

        protected StringBuilder encodeHexString(StringBuilder content,
                                        String contents)
        Encodes the given contents string into a valid postscript hex string.
        Parameters:
        content - current content stream to append literal string to.
        contents - string to be encoded into '<...></...>' hex format.
        Returns:
        original content stream with contents encoded in the hex string format.

      • checkAppearance

        protected boolean checkAppearance(String appearance)
        Utility to try and determine if the appearance is valid.
        Parameters:
        appearance - appearance ot test.
        Returns:
        true if valid, false otherwise.

      • findSelectionRectangle

        protected Rectangle2D.Float findSelectionRectangle(String markedContent)
        The selection rectangle if present will help define the line height of the text. If not present we can use the default value 13.87 later which seems to be very common in the samples.
        Parameters:
        markedContent - content to look for "rg # # # # re".
        Returns:
        selection rectangle, null if not found.

      • generateRectangle

        protected String generateRectangle(Rectangle2D.Float rect)
        Simple utility to write Rectangle2D.Float in postscript.
        Parameters:
        rect - Rectangle2D.Float to convert to postscript. Null value with throw null pointer exception.
        Returns:
        postscript representation of the rect.

      • parseRectanglePoints

        protected float[] parseRectanglePoints(String potentialNumbers)
        Converts a given string of four numbers into an array of floats. If a conversion error is encountered null value is returned.
        Parameters:
        potentialNumbers - space separated string of four numbers.
        Returns:
        list of four numbers, null if string can not be converted.

        Parameters:

        public void setEnableHighlightedWidget(boolean enableHighlightedWidget)
        Set enable highlight on an individual widget.
        Parameters:
        enableHighlightedWidget - true to enable highlight mode, otherwise false.

      • setHighlightAlpha

        public static void setHighlightAlpha(float highlightAlpha)
        Set the static alpha value uses to paint a color over a widget annotation.
        Parameters:
        highlightAlpha - highlight alpha value between zero and one.

      • isEnableHighlightedWidget

        public boolean isEnableHighlightedWidget()
        Is enable highlight enabled.
        Returns:
        return true if highlight is enabled, false otherwise.
